page.title: 15POPULATION
page.content: The survey was conducted in Patcham about people in the area.The information was:Jobs,Transport To Work,Ages and Places Of Work. The main occupations were:Housewives, Vicars,Civil Engineers and Clerks. Seven people were retired.Most people aged 30-40 years.Most of the interviewies worked in the Brighton area.Many people travelled to work by car although some used the train or rode a bicycle.Among the unusual jobs were:Furniture Restorer,Computer Anylist and an Aerial Rigger.The average age of the interviewies was 39.Most men go to work while the wife stays at home.Many middle-aged men were employed in offices,while the older men had less demanding jobs.Many women were housewives but a few without young children were Secretaries or Nurses.
